boat.construction_details: Pine on oak with a lead ballast keel
boat.name: Citara

ownerships.note: Sold to Judge Thomas Chatfield-Clarke, architect of Wooton Creek, in 1895, where she remained until 1945. PUrchased by JH Dible in 1946. sold to Viscount Caldicote and the Hon. James Borwick in 1954. Sold to the owner of Norris Castle, Isle of Wight, 1962. Fred Brookes bought her in 1972, and sold her to Gordon and Sue Stephenson in 1974. Owned by Bob Munden, OGA Solent Area Treasurer from 1974.
ownerships.text: Sold to Judge Thomas Chatfield-Clarke, architect of Wooton Creek, in

boat.short_description: Believed to have been built as a smack in 1887, named 'Rover', by Aldous of Brightlingsea, although she probably never fished owing to the state of the herring industry at the time. In 1895 she is listed in Lloyds Register as 'Citara', when it is assumed she was converted to a yacht.
